definition: root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc

sentences.english: Hold your own, know your name, and go your own way.
sentences.chinese: 堅持自我，不要忘本，走自己的路。

sentences.english: It takes more than good memory to have good memories.
sentences.chinese: 不忘本需要比好的記憶力更好的本事。

sentences.english: One must not forget his origin, now that he is appointed to the leading post.
sentences.chinese: 當了領導幹部可不能忘本。

sentences.english: Or walk with Kings - nor lose the common touch.
sentences.chinese: 或者能與王者同行，而不忘本。

definition: to recount history but omit one's ancestors (idiom); to forget one's roots
to forget favors and violate justice (idiom); ingratitude to a friend/to kick a benefactor in the teeth
see 吃水不忘掘井人[chi1 shui3 bu4 wang4 jue2 jing3 ren2]
pinyin: chi1 shui3 bu4 wang4 wa1 jing3 ren2

definition: to conduct oneself/to behave with integrity
grateful and seeking to repay the kindness (idiom)
the benevolent man cannot be rich (idiom, from Mencius). It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven (Matthew 19:24).
to come back to one's hometown in silken robes (idiom); to return in glory
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
lit. to destroy the bridge after crossing the river (idiom)/fig. to abandon one's benefactor upon achieving one's goal
to look down upon/to hold in contempt
poor but with great ambitions (idiom)/poor but principled
(to play) one's part/one's role/one's duty/(to stay within) one's bounds/dutiful/keeping to one's role
